sectionText: Nutritional Neuroscience is an emerging interdisciplinary field that is directly related to some of the major public health challenges facing today?s society. This course will cover content in nutrition and cognitive neuroscience to determine the impact of nutrients and foods on selective aspects of executive function and hippocampal-dependent memory. Topics covered will include methodological techniques to study nutritional effects on brain, acute meal effects on cognitive function, micro- and macronutrient influences, gut-brain communication, and central regulation of eating behavior.
